alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Belknap and north central Merrimack Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Canterbury, or near Franklin, moving northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Meredith, Canterbury, Danbury, Boscawen, Bristol, Andover, Alexandria, Hill, Tilton, Sanbornton, New Hampton, Northfield and Salisbury. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 48 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
